metadata.title: CVE-2022-23519 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description: rails-html-sanitizer is responsible for sanitizing HTML fragments in Railsapplications. Prior to version 1.4.4, a possible XSS vulnerability withcertain configurations of Rails::Html::Sanitizer may allow an attacker toinject content if the application developer has overridden the sanitizer'sallowed tags in either of the following ways: allow both "math" and "style"elements, or allow both "svg" and "style" elements. Code is only impactedif allowed tags are being overridden. . This issue is fixed in version1.4.4. All users overriding the allowed tags to include "math" or "svg" and"style" should either upgrade or use the following workaround immediately:Remove "style" from the overridden allowed tags, or remove "math" and "svg"from the overridden allowed tags.

criterions.comment: ruby-rails-html-sanitizer package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
